content: enchanted heart crochet pattern by ashley maglich/your craft gremlin ©ashleymaglich this pattern is for your personal use do not share any portions of this pattern in any form for others to use you are 100% free to sell any physical items made with this pattern please feel free to tag me @ashleymaglich or link to the pattern in any posts or mentions of thank you so much for your support i look forward to seeing what you create for more free patterns & video tutorials come join me over on youtube ashley maglich - youtube abbreviations us terms ● mc - magic_ring ● chain - chain ● single_crochet - single_crochet ● double_crochet - double_crochet ● 1/2 double_crochet - half_double_crochet ● fo - fasten_off ● slip_stitch - slip stich materials yarn crochet hook *in tutorial i used 3mm* though you can use whatever size hook & coordinating yarn scissors darning needle - to sew in ends i will be referring to this pattern in steps vs rounds or row step 1 mc ch3 *counts as double_crochet 2dc into the ring pull center closed ©ashleymaglich step 2 ch3 *counts as double_crochet turn your work 2dc into the 1st stitch 3dc into the last stitch ©ashleymaglich step 3 ch3 *counts as double_crochet turn your work 2dc in the first stitch 3dc between clusters 3dc into top of ch3 ©ashleymaglich step 4 ch3 *counts as double_crochet turn your work 2dc into the 1st stitch 3dc between the cluster spaces 3dc into the top of ch3 ©ashleymaglich you are going to repeat step 4 for the next 7 rounds ©ashleymaglich step 5 ch3 *counts as double_crochet turn your work skip the next space between the clusters 3dc in the next 8 spaces between the clusters skip the last space double_crochet in the top of the ch3 ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich step 6 ch3 *counts as double_crochet turn your work skip next space 3dc in the next 3 spaces between clusters double_crochet in the next space ©ashleymaglich step 7 ch3 *counts as double_crochet 3dc in the next 2 spaces between clusters double_crochet last space ©ashleymaglich step 8 ch3 *counts as double_crochet 3dc in the next space between clusters double_crochet in the last space ch1 & fo ©ashleymaglich step 9 in the same space where your first single double_crochet is attach yarn & ch3 *counts as double_crochet ©ashleymaglich 3dc in the next 3 spaces between clusters 1dc in the last space ©ashleymaglich step 10 ch3 *counts as double_crochet turn your work 3dc next 2 spaces between clusters 1dc in the last space step 11 ch3 *counts as double_crochet turn your work 3dc in the next space between clusters 1dc in the last space ©ashleymaglich step 12 make 2 double_crochet in the same space as last double_crochet 3dc in the next space around the double_crochet repeat around the next double_crochet ©ashleymaglich now you will be making 3dc around the last double_crochet in each of the next 10 clusters down ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich you are now at the first 3dc cluster we
